Specific Details: Policy on e-cigarettes
DPOs Lobbied: Dara Murphy|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Mattie McGrath|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Policy on e-cigarettes
Intended Results: Request a meeting to discuss the potential role of e-cigarettes in achieving Tobacco Free Ireland's objective of reducing smoking rates, the need for policy by the DoH and for a debate in the Dail on the topic.::Highlight the conclusions of the House of Commons Science and Technology Committee report on e-cigarettes, which overwhelmingly concludes that not only are e-cigarettes substantially less harmful than traditional cigarettes but that they can be used to significantly reduce smoking rates.

Specific Details: Tipperary County Council blocked a right of Way in the housing estate called Moyne Road in Thurles. It had been open for over 40 years. They built a wall to block access
DPOs Lobbied: Matt Shortt|Director of Services or Equivalent|Tipperary County Council::Joe McGrath|Chief Executive Officer|Tipperary County Council::Mattie McGrath|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Tipperary County Council blocked a right of Way in the housing estate called Moyne Road in Thurles. It had been open for over 40 years. They built a wall to block access
Intended Results: How much the total cost of building the wall, what legislation did they fully in order to built the wall, why wasnt proper notice given to the residents before building the wall, why was the wall built at 7.30 am on a Saturday Morning, and to knock the wall and work with the residents in creating a walkway for residents
Lobbying Activities:
Dear All,

 

I email in my role as Chairman of the Moyne Road Residents Association in relation to the wall that was erected to block our right of way against the expressed wishes of our residents in November 2018 at 7.00 am on a Saturday morning.

 

The building of this wall has resulted in extreme health and safety concerns as people are now jumping over the wall out onto the main road (People are jumping straight out onto the road as there is no public footpath at this point)

 

We as residents are now calling on the council to immediately remove the wall and enter into negotiations with our residents in relation to this issue. The council had no problem entering into talks with the potential homeowners at Cabra but they refuse to interact with the residents of Moyne Road.  We have offered the council 10,000 euro to address any concerns that they may have in relation to this access point. It is important to note that no accident ever occurred at this access point,|Email|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Tommy Barrett, Chairperson of the Moyne Road Residents Association

Specific Details: Communication with Deputy Mattie McGrath TD in relation to the location and cost overruns at the new National Children's Hospital
Subject Matter: Communication with Deputy Mattie McGrath TD in relation to the location and cost overruns at the new National Children's Hospital
Intended Results: In 2015/2016 The Jack & Jill Children's Foundation documented its position in relation to the location of the National Children's Hospital. The charity's position has remained the same and co-location with a maternity hospital continues to be a top priority. The charity suggested that the location of the hospital be switched to Connolly Hospital, where it could stand along with the relocated Rotunda Maternity Hospital. Our interaction with Deputy McGrath reiterated our position
Lobbying Activities: Email to Deputy Mattie McGrath TD in relation to an invitation to attend a meeting about the location and cost overruns at the new National Children's Hospital in the AV Room of Leinster House attended by a group of parents and other interest groups. Subsequently Jack & Jill was not in a position to attend. Carmel Doyle CEO also shared an email copy of a statement that Jack & Jill gave to the Irish Times in relation to the issue|Email|1::Phone-calls with Deputy Mattie McGrath's assistant in relation to an invitation to Jack & Jill to attend a meeting about the location and cost overruns at the new National Children's Hospital in the AV Room of Leinster House attended by a group of parents and other interest groups. Subsequently Jack & Jill was not in a position to attend.|Phone call|2-5
